alert.note: Alert for Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 6:39PM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Tioga. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Wellsboro, Morris, Elkland, Blossburg, Covington, Arnot, Millerton, Keeneyville, Ogdensburg, Tioga, Roseville, Tioga Junction, Osceola and Mansfield University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
